data.name: TooltipBlenderPath
data.value:
Path to the Blender executable. No need to have the import addon installed, it is included with PKX-IconGen. It's recommended to use Blender 3.6.X LTS. Blender 2.9.3 LTS or higher should also work, but is not tested anymore.
On Windows: Path to the Blender executable.
On MacOS: The default path is included, if any aliases have been made for Blender for different versions, you can specify that alias for Blender here. I also have no idea how OSX works exactly to be honest. üòÇ
On Linux: Path to the Blender executable. It is possible to specify a link or an application name accessible from PATH like "blender" or "blender_293".

data.name: TooltipOptionnalArguments
data.value:
Additionnal optional arguments to pass to Blender. You normally do not need to input anything here.
USE ONLY IF YOU KNOW WHAT YOU'RE DOING.

data.name: TooltipOutputPath
data.value: Output path for the generated icons.

data.name: TooltipIconStyle
data.value:
Styles based on Pok√©mon Colosseum, Pok√©mon XD: Gale of Darkness or Pok√©mon Battle Revolution.
Face Icons: Pok√©mon Colosseum has no cropping. Pok√©mon XD uses the same rendering as Colosseum, but rounded corners are used for each icon. Pok√©mon Battle Revolution uses different rendering as the Gamecube games, have a circle crop and a white outline. NOT AVAILABLE YET.
Face Icons: Pok√©mon Colosseum only uses the first box frame. Pok√©mon XD uses all 3 box frames to animate in the Purification Chamber. Otherwise, only the first frame is used. Pok√©mon Battle Revolution. NOT AVAILABLE YET.

data.name: TooltipRenderScale
data.value:
Integer scale used to know at what resolution the icons are going to be rendered.
Use x1 for making new pokemon icons to be imported. Use the others for texture packs or any higher resolution needs.
Base face icon resolution for Colo/XD: 42px X 42px Base face icon resolution for PBR: 48px X 48px
Base box icon resolution for Colo/XD: 64px X 64px Base box icon resolution for PBR: 54px X 54px
Please note that this can drastically increase the rendering and processing time depending on your computer.

data.name: TooltipAssetsPath
data.value:
Optional if custom Pokemon are used, needed for default Pokemon. Useful when exporting and sharing Pokemon data.
From there you can include {{AssetsPath}} in a model path. Don't include a trailing slash or backslash. This is the "Game Files" folder from Colosseum Tool or GoD-Tool. Make sure to "export" everything containing "pkx".
In Colosseum/GoD Tool: Go in 4. Import/Export files Filter with "pkx" Enter "export"

data.name: TooltipShinyToggle
data.value: Toggle between Normal and Shiny data. Purple areas means that data switches between Normal and Shiny.

data.name: TooltipOutputName
data.value: Output name for the rendered file. If unspecified, uses the Pokemon's name.

data.name: TooltipModelPath
data.value:
Path to the Pokemon model. It should be a .pkx or .dat file. A .pkx file contains extra information like shiny colors.
If it is in the assets folder, you can specify {{AssetsPath}} instead of manually going in the folder. Example: {{AssetsPath}}/pkx_lugia/lugia.pkx
NOTE: CHANGING THE MODEL AFTER SETTING UP TEXTURES OR REMOVED OBJECTS WILL RESET THEM DUE TO LIMITATIONS

data.name: TooltipShinyInfo
data.value: Data used to change the color of a Pokemon to make it shiny. You can sync up data from the game if you're using a .pkx model by using the Sync button. The colors can be manually changed in Blender.

data.name: TooltipShinyModelPath
data.value:
Model for the shiny version of the Pokemon. It should be a .pkx or .dat file. A .pkx file contains extra information like shiny colors.
If your shiny model is in the assets folder, you can specify {{AssetsPath}} instead of manually going in the folder. Example: {{AssetsPath}}/pkx_lugia/pkx_lugia.pkx.dat
NOTE: CHANGING THE MODEL AFTER SETTING UP TEXTURES OR REMOVED OBJECTS WILL RESET THEM DUE TO LIMITATIONS

data.name: TooltipBackgroundColor
data.value: Background color for this icon. Box icons are usually transparent, otherwise color boxes appear in-game.

data.name: TooltipGlowColor
data.value: Glow/Outline color for this icon. Setting it to fully transparent will disable the effect.

data.name: TooltipInsertAssetsPath
data.value: Insert "{{AssetsPath}}" to the current caret location. You cannot have more than 1 "{{AssetsPath}}" in your path.

data.name: TooltipBoxToggle
data.value: Toggle between Face and Box data. Purple areas means that data switches between Normal and Shiny.

data.name: TooltipBoxAnimationFrame
data.value: Choose the animation frame to preview. Pokemon Colosseum only uses the first frame.
